oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Metal-Gate Granularity-Induced Threshold Voltage Variability and Mismatch in Si Gate-All-Around Nanowire n-MOSFETs
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: NAYAK, K
AGARWAL, S
BAJAJ, M
OLDIGES, PJ
MURALI, KVRM
RAO, VR
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Gate-all-around (GAA)
metal-gate granularity (MGG)
mismatch
silicon nanowire FET
threshold voltage
variability
work function (WF)
WORK FUNCTION
TRANSISTORS
PERFORMANCE
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: The metal-gate granularity-induced threshold voltage (V-T) variability and V-T mismatch in Si gate-all-around (GAA) nanowire n-MOSFETs (n-NWFETs) are studied using coupled 3-D statistical device simulations considering quantum corrected room temperature drift-diffusion transport. The impact of metal-gate crystal grain size on linear and saturation mode V-T variability are analyzed. The V-T mismatch study predicts lower mismatch figure of merit (A(VT)) in TiN-gated Si GAA n-NWFETs compared with the reported experimental mismatch data for TiN-gated Si FinFETs.
